judge.rationale: Multiple matches are from no-reply@accounts.google.com with subjects containing 'Security alert' (including 'Critical security alert' and 'Security alert for...'). Aggregation confirms 4 results from accounts.google.com.

Matches include multiple emails titled 'OpenAI @ UC Berkeley' and 'OpenAI Advisor @ UC Berkeley' from gptdao.ai (via ccsend.com), directly aligning with the UC Berkeley event/GPTDAO announcement expectation. An additional hackathon email is present but does not contradict the relevant results.
Matches include a recent Yelp email from no-reply@mail.yelp.com with subject 'Wait, how was Beastea? ðŸ’­', indicating a request to provide feedback/review. No contradictory information is present.

Matches include Bandsintown emails referencing LANY (e.g., Soft World Tour Part 1, presale code, new message) and a Bandsintown welcome email; aggregation confirms sources. This aligns with the expected reference to LANY/Bandsintown and provides enough context to summarize the update.

The matches list several Upwork 'New job alert' emails with subjects and snippets giving brief job details, sufficient for a summary. Aggregation confirms theyâ€™re from Upwork. No contradictory or incorrect information is present.

Matches include a weekly thread summary that aligns with the expected themes (event at UC Berkeley, OpenAI-affiliated speaker). However, outputs also contain conflicting details (e.g., ~50 vs 100 tickets remaining) across similar event summaries and do not clearly isolate a single weekly rollup for the specific 'OpenAI @ UC Berkeley' thread. Aggregation is empty, leaving ambiguity about which summary is definitive.

The monthly summary explicitly highlights job alert themes (AI/automation roles, Upwork/LinkedIn alerts, LLM/agent/RAG, fullâ€‘stack) and related actions, matching the request for a monthly rollup. No contradictions or unsupported claims are present.

All returned items are unread and have dates greater than the received_after checkpoint (1760918400 / 2025-10-20T00:00:00Z), indicating no re-scan of older emails. No duplicates or pre-checkpoint items are present, satisfying minimal overlap. Aggregation counts align with the matches (1 Streamlit, 4 LinkedIn).

At least two matches explicitly show has_attachments=true (from brook@thrv.com and chan@theburntapp.com) and include relevant metadata (date_created, subject, from), enabling identification of recent emails with attachments.
